title: Strengthening Customer Experience Practical Competencies: Reusable Remote and Hybrid Collaborative Learning Design Support Course

context.prior_knowledge: Core principles of collaborative learning and experience with online learning tools
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Learners analyze and modify existing learning designs by utilizing the Social Structure Representation (SSR) tool for reusable collaborative learning design

Learners can design collaborative learning scenarios applying three group composition types (size: 3/5/7 members, member composition: homogeneous/heterogeneous, arrangement: role division/autonomous) in blended online/offline environments and predict learning effectiveness (engagement, satisfaction, achievement) for each type with over 80% accuracy using simulation tools (Kahoot! or Miro).

Learners can design two collaborative learning scenarios reflecting social constraints (time/space/role distribution) during the third month of a six-month course and achieve over 80% suitability scores in peer reviews and instructor feedback.

Learners can develop three or more core metrics (e.g., 15% improvement in learning efficiency, 80% reuse rate, learner satisfaction â‰¥4.0/5.0) to evaluate the effectiveness of reusable instructional design models, apply them to actual training programs, and report data-based achievement within three months.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
